content.description: Top rope problem setup by the route to the right of this one
Slabby route on fine granite rock. Crux at the top

Overflow ascends the curving lay back flake above the anchors of Fishing for Holds. Climb up and right to an interesting series of moves to a steep spot. Undercling through a roof and continue up and left following flakes and features to chains at the end of the roof. Passing the 6th bolt is the crux. The route goes higher to another anchor but due to terrible rope drag is not recommended.
content.location: This begins above the ledge with anchors of Fishing for Holds. Follow flakes and interesting features past 8 bolts. The route can be climbed in a long pitch from the ground.  A 80m rope is nice but you can do it on a single 60m if you lower-pull-lower back to the midway anchors. Extendable runners are useful on bolts 4 & 5.

content.description:
crux near top.

great fun route

bolted anchr
Great route to have fun on. Slabby with some crack to work with

climbs.name: Green New Deal
climbs.fa: May 2020 Bill Leventhal,  Jack Marshall,  Cecilia Hernandez, Jerome Weber

content.description: This fun climb takes on the steep green wall left of Fish Ladder. Steep moves on outstanding rock follow flakes and a ramp to a spectacular finish. This is one of the best routes at the crag and destined to become popular. The climbing is easier than it looks, a rarity.
content.location: Begin at the alcove below Fish Ladder. Climb that route for 30 feet passing the 1st roof on the left, before heading up and left up flakes and a ramp to the amazing features leading to the anchors.

climbs.name: Go Fish
climbs.fa: Jack Marshall, Cecilia Hernandez, Bill Leventhal  7-4-2020

content.description: Go Fish is a second pitch for Fishing for Holds. It climbs the shallow corner above and slightly left of the ledge/ top anchors for Fishing for Holds. Traverse in to the corner from the right past 2 closely spaced bolts. Follow the corner then face past 3 more bolts to a difficult and tricky crux at the 6th bolt. Continue up to a bulge and another bolt, passing to the right and joining Overflow for it's last 2 bolts to a shared anchor. Longer draws on the 4th and 5th bolt and a runner on the 8th bolt (1st shared bolt on the Overflow) will help reduce rope drag especially when climbing it as one long pitch from the ground.
content.location: Starts just left of Overflow, off the ledge/ top anchors for Fishing for Holds. Can be done in one long pitch from the ground, (extend, back clean or skip some bolts on Fishing for Holds to reduce rope drag) as a LPL or better yet with a 80m rope which will barely allow you to lower to the ground. Tie a knot in the bottom end of the rope.

content.description: Slab to the right of Lichen It. Ends at a 4 bolt anchor. 1 bolt was missing a hanger.
At the top, small edges, are about ready to break off
content.location: Just to the right of the big roof around the edge.

content.description:
Start at the pine tree below a small roof. Trad climbing to the right side of small roof then up a set of small cracks 5.6 past a small pine tree to a ledge. Continue to the left up easy climbing to a 2 bolt anchor below a small roof and below the arete.

Climb to bolt on arete, clip bolt and ascend arete, protecting arete with small cam (a little spicy) At the top of the arete is a 2 bolt anchor ( short pitch) From here head to the top with sparse gear. Belay behind a large rock or make a gear anchor. Walk off to the North fourth with some fifth class downclimbing.

The crux is the second pitch. Look for bolt on the arete.
content.protection: Trad gear on pitch 1, 1 bolt with 2 bolted anchors on pitch 2. Pitch three belay behind big rock. Walk off, some tricky down climbing at times.
content.location: When you come up to the crag from the river approach, the climb starts where you can go to the climbs on the river or up the hill to the other climbs. Look for a pine tree at the start.

content.description: The crux s near the top. Great positioning. You may want to bring some gear to place before the first bolt
content.protection: bolts and gear for the beginning

climbs.name: El Pescador
climbs.fa: September 3, 2018  William Leventhal & Jeff Lieberman with help from Guy Keesee

content.description: This is a fully bolted 2nd pitch above the anchors of Lichin It.  You can do it in one long pitch (150') or do it as a 2nd pitch above Lichin It.
content.protection: 7 bolts  to ring anchors.  I added a bolt down low where there used to be a sketchy cam placement.
content.location: Located on the left side of the left side of the West face above Lichin It.

content.description: Easy sport route. May want to place a cam in the first part or stick clip the first bolt

climbs.name: 3G’s
climbs.fa: Brie Chartier, Emily Fisher, Selena Chau

content.description: A nice easy to protect little corner with a rose bush halfway up. Great place to practice trad and play in the shade. 3G’s = 3 genders that climbed it. - trans, cis, and non-binary.
content.protection: Medium range pieces. Easy natural anchors at the top.
content.location: Walk left of the ridge line past a small slab directly uphill from the highest point  circumnavigating the main spire. This little cliff is a couple hundred feet up and  is nestled in the trees separate from Fish Creek spire.
